pageContext.description: Long mid-rib on either face flanked by single short ribs which tend to curve inwards at bottom; very sl. emphasis of bl. corners; stumps of lp - possible miscast; hollows in side near bt. probably cg flaws; slight vertical rib in one sep. - off centre; traces of cg. fl.; no evidence for e. bev. or hammermarks; bt probably original; probably same mould/pattern as B.1 (1) and (2).
pageContext.surface: Dark brown to golden brown surface; some cracking and pocking of surface; edge and blade tips seem all broken - as are much of fgs.; one bt. corner possibly damaged; ? lacquered
pageContext.other: Width: EWe 53mm; ETst 26.8; Max T sep 7.5
pageContext.remarks: SN May 78; PI; AFI; CI; SI
